intro: Pilea gonavensis, commonly known as the Gonave pilea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Gonâve in Haiti. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically heart-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Pilea gonavensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
